Class CreditCard

  • java.lang.Object
    • CreditCard

  • public class CreditCard
extends java.lang.Object
    The CreditCard class is designed to create a CreditCard object and contains methods pertaining to the validation of the number entered by the user.

      • getCardNumber

        public java.lang.String getCardNumber()
        Getter method
        Returns:
        Credit card number

      • setCardNumber

        public void setCardNumber(java.lang.String x)
        Setter method
        Parameters:
        Credit - card number

      • getCardType

        public java.lang.String getCardType()
        Checks if the card number entered by the user is equal to either the MasterCard, Amex, or Visa card lengths. If a match is found, if checks to see if there is a prefix match as well. If both tests match, then the corresponding credit card type is returned as a type String. (e.g. "Master Card").
        Returns:
        Credit card type

      • isLengthValid

        public boolean isLengthValid()
        Checks if the credit card number entered is a valid length by matching expected lengths.
        Returns:
        true ; false

      • isNumberValid

        public boolean isNumberValid()
        If isLengthValid and isPrefixValid are both true. This method checks the validity of the credit card number entered by using the check sum algorithm. Returns true if the resulting number is divisible by ten.
        Returns:
        true ; false

      • isPrefixValid

        public boolean isPrefixValid()
        Checks if the credit card number entered has a valid prefix number by matching expected prefix numbers.
        Returns:
        true ; false
